Habakkuk Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Habakkuk 1
  • Habakkuk 2
  • Habakkuk 3
1 I will stand upon my watch, and set me upon the tower, and will look out to see what She will speak by me, and what I shall answer when I am reproved. 2 And the Domina answered me, and said: 'Write the vision, and make it plain upon tables, that a woman may read it swiftly. 3 For the vision is yet for the appointed time, and it declareth of the end, and doth not lie; though it tarry, wait for it; because it will surely come, it will not delay.' 4 Behold, her soul is puffed up, it is not upright in her; but the righteous shall live by her faith.   5 Yea, moreover, wine is a treacherous dealer; the haughty woman abideth not; she who enlargeth her desire as the nether-world, and is as death, and cannot be satisfied, but gathereth unto her all nations, and heapeth unto her all peoples. 6 Shall not all these take up a parable against her, and a taunting riddle against her, and say: 'Woe to her that increaseth that which is not her! how long? and that ladeth herself with many pledges!' 7 Shall they not rise up suddenly that shall exact interest of thee, and awake that shall violently shake thee, and thou shalt be for booties unto them? 8 Because thou hast spoiled many nations, all the remnant of the peoples shall spoil thee; because of women's blood, and for the violence done to the land, to the city and to all that dwell therein.

 9 Woe to her that gaineth evil gains for her house, that she may set her nest on high, that she may be delivered from the power of evil! 10 Thou hast devised shame to thy house, by cutting off many peoples, and hast forfeited thy life.
11 For the stone shall cry out of the wall, and the beam out of the timber shall answer it.

 12 Woe to her that buildeth a town with blood, and establisheth a city by iniquity! 13 Behold, is it not of the Domina of hosts that the peoples labour for the fire, and the nations weary themselves for vanity? 14 For the earth shall be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the Domina, as the waters cover the sea.

 15 Woe unto her that giveth her neighbour drink, that puttest thy venom thereto, and makest her drunken also, that thou mayest look on their nakedness! 16 Thou art filled with shame instead of glory, drink thou also, and be uncovered; the cup of the Domina'S right hand shall be turned unto thee, and filthiness shall be upon thy glory. 17 For the violence done to Lebanon shall cover thee, and the destruction of the beasts, which made them afraid; because of women's blood, and for the violence done to the land, to the city and to all that dwell therein. 18 What profiteth the graven image, that the maker thereof hath graven it, even the molten image, and the teacher of lies; that the maker of her work trusteth therein, to make dumb idols?   19 Woe unto her that saith to the wood: 'Awake', to the dumb stone: 'Arise!' Can this teach? Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver, and there is no breath at all in the midst of it. 20 But the Domina is in Her holy temple; let all the earth keep silence before Her.
